comment: AVOID! He is rude, confusing and MEAN! He thinks everybody is lazy and a cheater! Do not recommend to anyone! Please!
If you take notes and actually study them for the tests.. you'll make a B. If you blow off his class you will fail. Don't expect to get an A no matter how much you memorize though.

I took his class w/o even looking at his rating. Worse mistake ever. Don't bother buying the book, he'll take points off if used in your essays. His test are multiple choice then a essay. I would always ace the multiple choice, never got credit on the essay (I'm a English major). One day during an exam, I had enough. I just got up and left. :)
He isn't that bad if you just show up to class and can get main points out of his lecture. Tests aren't too bad if you study but he doesn't give out A's easily.

MUST TAKE NOTES! I can not stress that enough. Do not buy textbook, it is completely useless. Gives 5 exams with essay worth 20 points each and 5 map quizzes worth one point each. Class is mandatory or you will miss a lot of notes. If you do not study notes, you will fail.

He is AWFUL. Avoid this professor at all costs. You basically have 2 grades in this class because the quizzes and "pop quizzes" barely budge your grade. He failed our ENTIRE class on our midterm (the first of only 2 tests). He speaks the whole class without any sort of order. No study guides. Don't buy the textbook, he takes off points if used.

looks like carlton from fresh prince of belair, He just rambles the whole class and he does not give study guides and he takes a 101 class way to seriously, if you have to take him make sure you attend every class and good luck trying to take notes because he talks soooo fast!

This teacher has vague rules and rubric for his class, he has told us several times in class that he grades his test based on our participation in class. He also grades his midterm and final questions based on how difficult he felt the question was. An easier question to answer will be graded harder by him. If you like horrible teachers he is for u

He is awful! DO NOT TAKE! His midterm and final are ridiculously hard. If you miss ANYTHING in his lecture, you are screwed (by the way, no laptops or electronics used during class). Pen and paper note-taking. I have always excelled at history and legitimately loved the subject, but Mr. Fields made me dread coming to class. You were warned....
His lectures are boring and rambling. His grading is unduly harsh. Avoid this class.

Actual university level professor who isn't looking to give easy A's. Only take him if you have an interest in learning and working for your grade. He's funny, clear on what he expects from you and his guidelines for the class.

Honestly, he has a major case of say one thing do the other. He wants us to read the book and yet he doesn't accept things on the test unless we covered them in class. Also, he most likely isn't aware that having a rubric means that you need to grade by the rubric. My midterm was graded seemingly at his discretion
AVOID!! He is not helpful. Quizzes are timed without option to click back. He is very picky on his essay and he is never clear of what he wants you to write! Put him in one word: HORRIBLE!!

Do not under any circumstances take this class or any class taught by professor fields. Mid term and final are essays and are based on his lectures NOT the book. He expects you to take notes every class without using any electronics. No laptop no iPad just a pencil and paper. Save your GPA just take the class online

Do not get in his class lectures are boring and useless midterm and final are both essay's. You will have four online quizzes which are easy but the essay's are ridiculous you will have six topics and you will not get to choose which one you want to write about it will be chosen for you. Overall stay away from this professor.
